clues.clue: (I'm Gretchen Morgenson.)  Stories like "How Did They Value Stocks?  Count The Absurd Ways" won me a 2002 Pulitzer for beat reporting.  My beat is this street

clues.category: THE NEW YORK TIMES PULITZER WINNERS
clues.clue: (I'm James Risen.)  With my Times colleague Eric Lichtblau, I won a Pulitzer in 2006 for our disclosure of the Bush administration's use of domestic electronic eavesdropping without these legal documents issued by a judge

clues.category: THE NEW YORK TIMES PULITZER WINNERS
clues.clue: (I'm Amy Harmon.)  I won my second Pulitzer in 2008 for a series about the new information that can be gleaned about a person's genetic profile with this kind of test which some people welcome & others prefer not to know

clues.category: THE NEW YORK TIMES PULITZER WINNERS
clues.clue: (I'm Linda Greenhouse.)  I won a 1998 Pulitzer for covering the Supreme Court with articles like "Why" this name of a failed nominee "Is Still a Verb in Politics 10 Years Later"
